All good with the first 16 miles

review.name: Good shoes

review.name: Bondi 8
review.reviewBody: I have several Bondi 8 and love them. I have a wish list for the Bondi 9 from my son as a Mothers Day gift. I will always buy Hoka shoes because of comfort. Wished they had dressy sandals

review.name: I would definitely buy these again.The Bondi's are the best
review.reviewBody: These Bondi's are excellent for walking and standing up all day. Every nurse should have a pair or two. I've owned about 6 pair over the years

review.name: Comfortable & Good Looking
review.reviewBody: Love these Bondi 8's. The colors are perfect for spring and summer.  So very comfortable!!

review.name: I'm. Not sure??
review.reviewBody:
Does it take several days wearing them to form to your foot?
Should the cushion pad be removed?

review.name: HAPPY FEET!!
review.reviewBody:
I'm very pleased with my purchase of  your Bondi 8 sneakers.
Last year I was falling a lot, finally figured out it was my feet! I had neuropathy numbing my toes and the ball of my foot for 10 years! The shoe search began. For me it wasn't just about comfort. I'm wearing my new HOKA sneakers and, not only is my foot encased with comfort, but my balance and the support it gives is a game changer! I don't love how large they look on my feet but for the security and comfort, it's a small price to pay. 
EXCELLENT shoe, I will be buying more

review.name: The only shoes I will ever wear
review.reviewBody: I've had problems with my feet all my life and I wish I knew about these shoes sooner. They are amazing. üëçüèª

review.name: AMAZING PRODUCT FOR SESAMOIDITIS
review.reviewBody: If I was rich, I would buy every pair of Hokas I come in contact with. I have very bad sesamoiditis, like very bad. Nothing has been working. I bought these shoes as my final effort and I can walk pain free now!!!!! I no longer have to get surgery thanks to these hokas. If you have sesamoiditis, I'm not saying you won't need surgery, but at the very least these shoes will give you so much relief. I sized up to 9 because it's what was left in stock, and while sure it's a bit bigger, you can adjust with the laces and it's not uncomfortable by any means. I LOVE YOU HOKA!!!!

review.name: Bondi 8
review.reviewBody: I love the Bondi 8. I've purchased at. Least 6 pairs and would again.

review.name: comfort and style
review.reviewBody: I'm a walker in my 70's and NOT a hiker.  These sneakers are awesome, I'm very hard on everything and they fit perfectly and they are very durable! I've actually broken oofos sandals and popped a big toe thru my ughs.  I live in the desert and the earth is extremely tough, these are my first pair of HOKA and definitely NOT my last!

raw.name: Men's Challenger 7
raw.description: Built at the intersection of road and trail, the new Challenger 7 has been completely reimagined from the ground up. Combining a simplified mesh upper with a soft new foam, we‚Äôve increased the stack height for a plusher feel and added proprietary rubber to the bottom unit, along with a reimagined outsole design for the best all-terrain ride yet. Inspired by gravel tires, we‚Äôve cued up smaller, tightly spaced lugs in center and larger, more aggressive lugs at the perimeter designed for improved traction on uneven terrain.

review.name: The BEST Shoes EVER!!
review.reviewBody: The Challenger 7 is one of my favorite Hoka shoes. I have been purchasing them for 10+ years and they beat the feet off of Nike's!! I work in healthcare and one day they had a scrub sale. They had a few Hoka choices so I said, "why not try them?" TI WAS WELL WORTH IT AND I WAS SOOOOOLD!! They add comfort and cush no other shoe does, THEY LAST and are well made AND they look great with the numerous styles and colors. I noticed after I purchased my 1st pair, other staff at the hospital started wearing them. I was asked several times how I liked them, several fellow emploees said how nice they looked and all of a sudden they started selling out at the scrub sales! It made me feel like a trendsetter and now most of the staff wear them. BTW, my daughter is a Nke Design Exec. and she still likes me, it's kind of a joke and I noticed Nike has started a design that looks very similar to the Hokas, just sayin!

review.name: Pretty darn awesome.
review.reviewBody: Great fit. I have since purchased 2 more pair. I am a recent Hoka convert, and have been very pleased. I prefer the more balanced platforms and look forward to trying other models. Thanks.

review.name: Feel amazing!
review.reviewBody: Switching from the speedgoat to challenger has given me confidence to put down some miles and not have sore feet and ankles at the end. Also jumped up a half size that gave me the space for my feet to heat up and not get tired. All and all love them.

review.name: I'll buy this shoe again
review.reviewBody: They're great on most surfaces but best in dirt.

review.name: Loyal customer.
review.reviewBody: Without a doubt my favorite athletic shoes bar none, every different model/style is superb.

review.name: Hoka #Elite
review.reviewBody: Can't wrong with Hoka. The best shoe on the market!

review.name: Challenger 7s
review.reviewBody: I hate to say this but i thought speed goats were my go to for runs, but i tried the challengers due to them being on sale and i gotta say i love them there a bit more comfortable then my speed goats while having the same reaction time fit true to size as well!

review.name: Great purchase.
review.reviewBody: The shoes are really comfortable.

review.name: Great shoe. I would buy again.
review.reviewBody: Bought for walking and hiking. I am 62 and can say that, after a week, these are some of the best active shoes I have ever owned. Light weight, great support, cushioned sole, etc. My only complaint is that I had to return my normal size 12 because they were way too snug. The 12.5 fits just right in my case, so you may want to consider the 1/2 size up.

review.name: yes
review.reviewBody: I like how easy it is to slide in and out of them and comfort

raw.name: All Gender ORA Recovery Slide 3
raw.description: Built off the blueprints of the beloved ORA Slide, we‚Äôve added four air flow channels for superior breathability. A comfort-driven style designed for downtime; this sustainable spinoff treads lighter with an earth-friendly sugarcane footbed. Grounded in the same dual-density geometry and injection-molded outsole as the original icon, the ORA Slide 3 delivers foot-cradling comfort in a future-friendly silhouette.

review.name: Superior support and comfort
review.reviewBody: These slides are amazing. The best value, comfort, and support of any product I have tried.

review.name: Therapeutic slides
review.reviewBody: Bought for my husband per the podiatrist's recommendation. He loved it and said it was very comfortable to wear inside the house.

review.name: Great!
review.reviewBody: My podiatrist told me that I shouldn't be walking around the house barefoot. So she recommended these recovery slides. At first I was hesitant because I don't like the Hoka sneaker, makes me feel like I'm rocking, but I decided to give them a go. And man I shouldn't have waited this long! They are awesome. I wear them most of the time when I'm home up until I go to bed. My feet haven't felt like this in a really long time! My only negative is the color. I have small feet and the neon green was the only color left.

review.name: Great Pair of House Shoes
review.reviewBody: I needed a new pair of house shoes and because of my plantar fascitis, I need something with good arch support. These definitely do the trick. They are comfortable and help keep my feet from hurting while walking around the house.

review.name: For my nephew
review.reviewBody: Gifted these to my 12 yr old newphew who is really into recovery shoes and all things soccer. He put them on immediately - even wore them outside in the snow and was disappointed that they wouldn't slide on the pond ice haha! So the slip resistance is really good! Ugly but functional sandals that most importantly were a hit with the recipient.

review.name: I would buy again just have to be more careful with sizing
review.reviewBody: I first bought this slides from Dick's sporting good in size 13 and ended being a little large for me. Then I bought them in 12 and were too small. This last pair I bought directly on hoka's website in size 13 and to my surprise they have a different size just in between of the first 2. Looks like the first one was sized as 14 but marked as 13

review.name: Great sandal
review.reviewBody: These slides are fantastic. Light, comfortable and great for around the house. I wea these often but especially when workouts fcaiae my plantar fasciatis to flair up.

review.name: Hoka Recovery shoes help me recover every day
review.reviewBody: i walk on average 7.71 miles per day.  i am older than most people.  i get back home.  i slip my Hoka Recovery shoes on.  I even wear them to the casino and the market.

review.name: hoka slides
review.reviewBody: I bought a pair for my husband and a pair for my daughter. Both love them and my husband wears them everyday in the house

review.name: Great comfort
review.reviewBody: Purchased my 2nd pair. It doesn't feel as soft as the first, but maybe i need to wear it more. Anyway, they are ugly, but I love them.

review.reviewBody: not much to say other then they fit properly are comfortable and if like other teva products I've had they wear well.

review.name: Beach Feet
review.reviewBody: Sometimes you find a shoe that synchs with you so well that you forget they are on, this shoe provided that experience.  Wet foot to dry foot, sandy foot to wet foot, swimming foot, boat foot the sandal handled it all.

review.name: What happened to the softness?
review.reviewBody: The footpads were much firmer than prior. Not soft and spongy as all had been prior. And even my prior ones, though soft, had the bottoms gradually losing connection and separating. What has happened to the brand I had hoped to live with forever?

review.name: Don't change a thing!
review.reviewBody: These are simple and comfortable, they also put up with ANYTHING! I basically wear these year-round and my feet thank me for it!

review.name: Very comfortable
review.reviewBody: The fit and construction are top notch.

review.name: Teva's Rock!
review.reviewBody: Consistently Tevas are great quality and durable.

review.name: Midform Universal Sandal I would buy again!
review.reviewBody: I bought these in a wonderful shoe shoe in Provincetown, MA during the summer.  I knew instantly they would be comfortable as long as I could tighten up the straps.  I did, they served me well all summer, and then I ordered the second pair in a platform height.  I love those, too!

review.name: Not the quality I used to know them for...
review.reviewBody: I am writing this as a Teva wearer of over 10 years, so I'd like to think my opinions on how they fit and feel have some oomph behind them! I was excited to receive a fresh pair after my last were finally wearing out, but these were not what I expected. They ripped at the triangle near the toes the 4th or 5th time I wore them, and now are basically trash. :( I've never had this happen, but I may go looking for a different go-to sandal after this.

review.name: Best sandals ever!
review.reviewBody: I love this sandal and I have had no issues at all with it. The fit is incredibly comfortable, and it's easy to layer with socks or tights for cooler weather. There is way more arch support than I expected from a sandal, which was an incredibly pleasant surprise! I feel like I can wear them all day and not worry about blisters or sore feet. It's like walking on clouds. Would 100% recommend and buy again!

review.name: Love these!
review.reviewBody:
So comfortable for all day wear   
Absolutely love the hot pink, tpo

jsonLd.descriptionSample: The ultimate all-terrain vehicle, the Terra Fi 5 Universal ups the ante with a fresh silhouette that‚Äôs lighter than ever before. Tailored for life‚Äôs detours, this quick-drying silhouette offers a mold

raw.name: Men's Terra Fi 5 Universal Hiking Sandal
raw.description: The ultimate all-terrain vehicle, the Terra Fi 5 Universal ups the ante with a fresh silhouette that‚Äôs lighter than ever before. Tailored for life‚Äôs detours, this quick-drying silhouette offers a molded PU midsole, ultra-grippy rubber outsole, and hook-and-loop closure to get you in and out in a flash.

review.name: I've been using Teva for over 35 years.
review.reviewBody: This version is a little narrower than my last pair. Seems there is a little less tract as well. The top ankle strap is too long. I've had this problem before and usually cut them shorter and melt the ends so they don't fray. But that doesn't end well.

review.name: Used to be better
review.reviewBody: I have used Teva products for over 30 years.  They are not the same.  I understand all things must change but these have not changed in a better way.  Sandals costing over 100 dollars should last more than 6 months.  I used to get anywhere from 18 to 14 months from a pair but no longer.  I thought it was a one off but this now seems the normal, sad.

review.name: Poor, Poorer and now Poorest
review.reviewBody: I've worn Teva's since the late 1980's, as many have and they lasted 7-10 years. The material and quality are now extremely poor and it seems intentional. My one year old Terra Fi 5 Universals are already wearing holes through the thin sole material before the tread pattern is even worn at all! This is after I had to repair them myself to keep the ankle straps in the foot bed after they pulled out. All these complaints are numerous and verified. These sandals are failing and will likely fail you when you need them most. Buyer beware! In the trash now and safe to say won't be wasting money on another six month pair.

review.name: I would buy them again. I proved that this is my 3rd pair
review.reviewBody: This is my 3rd pair of Teva Sandals. They are very comfortable and very durable. I love them.

review.name: The best!
review.reviewBody: The best!

raw.name: Women's Voya Infinity Sandal
raw.description: A study in laidback elegance‚Äîcombining the foot-forming comfort of our famed Mush‚Ñ¢ topsole and a feminine infinity upper crafted from a single stretchy elastic lace.

review.name: Great sandal for traveling
review.reviewBody: These are very lightweight and comfortable sandals. I brought them as my evening shoe on the Camino de Santiago. Sometimes I would wear them the last mile or so if my feet were tired of my walking shoe. They have a very soft sole which made them so comfortable. I have narrow feet so the elastic bands fit me well.

review.name: Please bring back the other Voya!
review.reviewBody: While I also like this sandal, The Voya with the more substantial bottom was truly amazing for Travel. I walked 15 miles in Rome in those but not in this smaller version. PLEASE bring back the other one before my last pair dies.

review.name: Straps are not stretchy enough to be comfortable
review.reviewBody: While these sandals are adorable and go well with practically any outfit, I hardly wear them due to how much they hurt my feet. The straps are pretty difficult to adjust, especially for those with carpal tunnel. Unfortunately sizing up wouldn't work for me as this size fits perfectly length wise.

review.name: Tight fit!
review.reviewBody: I have medium/narrow feet and these are tight! I have stretched them out and will wear them and they can be comfy for a while but sometimes my feet still feel like sausages and they always have marks when I get to take them off.

review.name: nope
review.reviewBody: too small and didn't get my money back

raw.name: Men's Grandview GORE-TEX Low Hiking Boot
raw.description: A low-pro take on the high-top Grandview GTX, this waterproof men‚Äôs hiker features the same Universal Heel Lock System, reengineered to accommodate a lower profile. Tackling day hikes and weeklong excursions with the same rugged dependability, this premium hiker combines waterproof leather and quick-dry mesh with a GORE-TEX waterproof bootie to seal out the elements.

review.name: Laces are impossible to tie
review.reviewBody:
Hi there,
I love the first pair of shoes I purchased from you but the laces on these are so short they are impossible to tie. I've been so busy I haven't had time to deal with it and it's been much too long. I'm sure there's a way to get them returned. Maybe buy another pair of the ones I like and use that box to send back the others? Or maybe you send different laces??..........Thanks!

review.name: Great shoe!
review.reviewBody: Have hiked 100s of miles in them.   Excellent shoes!

review.name: Lacing system needs a redesign
review.reviewBody: This shoe has potential. It's clearly well made but the lacing system is terrible. It's impossible to tighten the shoe very much due to the design and it's a huge flaw. Sizing the shoe down does nothing as well. My suggestion to Teva would be to test this with real world hikers during the design process. Keep it simple would be my suggestion.

review.name: Not for hiking
review.reviewBody:
Pros: shoe looks good, well constructed 
Cons: heavy, clunky. There is almost no way to tighten the heel down. The shoe uses some weird lacing system and therefore limits how much you can tighten the shoe rendering it completely useless for people who want to keep their heel from lifting when taking a step. 

Overall a disappointing shoe. My suggestion would be to test this with a group of actual hikers when designing the shoe. I don't understand why they would limit how tight you can lace the shoe.

review.name: Would like to buy again but they just don't hold up.
review.reviewBody: I admit I use my footwear hard. Really nice when I find a good fit like these GTXs' , really great on rock. Living in southern Utah there is a lot of sand. After about 6 mos. of intermittent use the shoes developed lumps along the inside edges of the soles. I was sure it was due to mid sole collapse. Took out the liners looking for rocks /sand whatever and found nothing. Threw them out as they were unwearable. But I wanted to understand what had deteriorated so badly. Pulled the shoes out of the trash and ran one through the band saw. Wow! Discovered pockets of sand between the sole and gortex liner. No way to remove without a band saw. Guess you could get after it with a razor knife but end result would be the same. Unusable! TOO BAD.

jsonLd.descriptionSample: A versatile men's   hiker designed for the modern trail, the Ridgeview Mid has been crafted with waterproof leather, a breathable mesh upper and durable traction for multi-day treks. Engineered with a

raw.name: Men's Ridgeview Hiking Boot
raw.description: A versatile men's   hiker designed for the modern trail, the Ridgeview Mid has been crafted with waterproof leather, a breathable mesh upper and durable traction for multi-day treks. Engineered with a waterproof bootie to seal out the elements and foot stabilizing shank, this high-top hiker is finished with a Vibram¬Æ Mega Grip outsole that performs well on both wet and dry terrain.

review.name: Nice Boot
review.reviewBody: I read all the reviews before purchasing these boots. Ordered my usual 9.5 but they were just a bit snug, and as others have stated, hard to get into. After an easy return to get size 10, a good fit  and with the laces loose and some break in time they go on no problem. Super light weight which I like. Wish they had a bit more arch support, may need an insert. Hopefully they'll hold up as an every day boot for walking,light hikes  and yard work.

review.name: Excellent boot, would buy again
review.reviewBody: Good looking boot that fits great, is comfortable, but sturdy where you want it, good materials and seems like it will hold up well.  Been using them for short hikes and for tactical shooting.  Nothing but good things to say!

review.name: I'm happy!
review.reviewBody:
Two small gripes: it's a bit tight to insert my foot, but once on, the fit is comfortable, with lots of toe space. 

The rough coating on the front part is flaking off; a slight aesthetic defect. 

Otherwise, I am very pleased with the Tevas!

review.name: Returned
review.reviewBody: Though I have purchased TEVA for years, I do not recommend this product.

review.name: Would buy this shoe again.
review.reviewBody: I work in the construction industry and stand on my feet all day so I use hiking boots to aide in my feet being comfortable and dry.  These boots are the best. I purchase purchased multiple pairs so I can have comfortable shoes for some time to come. Best hiking shoes I've purchased so far.

review.name: Eh

mainEntity.name: How does the Ghost mens sneaker on sale compare to Adreline GTS24?¬† Dose it provide the same support?
mainEntity.text: How does the Ghost mens sneaker on sale compare to Adreline GTS24?¬† Dose it provide the same support?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Ghost 16 is a neutral cushion style shoe whereas the Adrenaline GTS 24 is a support cushion style shoe. Our Support styles include our GuideRails technology, which supports your whole body in its natural stride while keeping excess movement in check. These styles are typically recommend if you overpronate. Overpronation is when you walk/run your ankles will roll inwards towards each other and onto your arches, putting a lot of pressure on the inside edge of your feet. The neutral cushion style shoes do not have the GuideRails technology.

review.description:
I recently picked up the Brooks Glycerin 21 after my go-to shoe, the Brooks Adrenaline, was out of stock. I was told the Glycerin was a good alternative, but unfortunately, it didn‚Äôt live up to that promise‚Äîat least not for me.

Right out of the box, the Glycerin 21 felt plush and well-cushioned, which initially gave me hope. However, once I started running, the comfort quickly disappeared. The fit felt off, especially around the arch and heel, and I noticed discomfort within the first couple of miles. After a few runs, the pain in my feet became consistent enough that I had to stop using them altogether.

To be fair, the Glycerin 21 might work well for runners who prefer a softer, more neutral shoe, but if you're coming from the Adrenaline‚Äîespecially if you rely on the stability features‚Äîit‚Äôs just not the same experience. I felt like I had less support, which may have contributed to the discomfort during runs.

Overall, I wouldn't recommend the Glycerin 21 as a substitute for the Adrenaline, especially if foot support and comfort are high priorities for you. Hopefully, the Adrenaline comes back in stock soon because this one just didn‚Äôt work for me.
I've gotten in about 10 outside runs (3-6 miles) now.  Good fit and feel.  I am more of a stability and support guys versus super cushioning.  It's been my new go-to pair.

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Dawn. We recommend going by the description of the width (i.e. narrow, medium, wide, extra-wide) as opposed to the letter designation (i.e. 2A, B, D, 2E, 4E) when converting between men's and women's sizing. A men's medium (D) width should fit the same as a women's medium (B) width. The conversion in sizing for length is 1.5 sizes. For example, a men's size 9D is equivalent to a women's size 10.5B.

mainEntity.name: I'm overweight ¬†i need a shoe that have cushion because I'm in the nursing field standing also flat feet. Which is a better fit for me ghost 16 or ghost max 2?
mainEntity.text: I'm overweight ¬†i need a shoe that have cushion because I'm in the nursing field standing also flat feet. Which is a better fit for me ghost 16 or ghost max 2?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Lelita, thanks for your question. Our shoes are designed with the run in mind, but they can work great for many activities! For long periods of standing, we recommend an option with a lot of cushion. If you are trying to decide between the two styles you mentioned, the Ghost Max 2 will offer more cushion underfoot which might feel better for longer periods of wear. If you over pronate or if your ankles or feet roll inwards, you might consider a support cushion style shoe instead like the Glycerin GTS 22. The GTS version has our GuideRail support system, which is intended to help support runners who overpronate (feet/ankles roll inward). If you don't over pronate, the Ghost Max 2 is a great option.

mainEntity.name: How long do the soles last? I've been averaging 5-6 months before having to go buy new pairs. I speed walk on the sidewalks in my neighborhood.
mainEntity.text: How long do the soles last? I've been averaging 5-6 months before having to go buy new pairs. I speed walk on the sidewalks in my neighborhood.

acceptedAnswer.text: When used for their intended purpose, performance running shoes have an expected lifespan of about 300-500 miles with regular use. When used as a daily walking shoe rather than specifically for running, the consistent sustained pressure to the mesh and cushioning components can cause the materials to degrade quicker. We recommend regular rotation of a few pairs of good shoes to ensure the highest level of performance.

mainEntity.name: I got my ghost 16 shoes muddy.¬† What is the best way to clean them?¬† Can I put them in the washing machine?
mainEntity.text: I got my ghost 16 shoes muddy.¬† What is the best way to clean them?¬† Can I put them in the washing machine?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Kathy. We recommend avoiding washing machines and (especially) dryers, but you can hand wash your shoes. Here are some tips as well as a link to an article that goes in greater depth: 1. Brush the bottom of your shoes to remove as much mud and dirt as possible. 2. Remove the shoelaces. 3. Gently use a damp cloth or brush to clean the uppers. 4. Rinse with warm water. 5. Remove the insoles and clean and dry them separately. 6. Stuff your shoes with newspaper. This helps them maintain shape and decreases drying time. For more information, please take a look at this article: https://www.brooksrunning.com/en_us/blog/gear-maintenance/how-to-clean-running-shoes.html

mainEntity.name: Are the ghost shoes good if you have a high arch?
mainEntity.text: Are the ghost shoes good if you have a high arch?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Joanne. The footbed and insoles of all of our shoes have the same arch height and arch support. Our shoe styles in our inventory are split into 2 sections, Neutral and Support. The support in running shoes is different than the support of insoles or orthotics. Our Support styles include our GuideRails technology, which supports your whole body in its natural stride while keeping excess movement in check. Insoles or orthotics give you support directly under the arch. Our sock-liners are removable so that you can input your own insole or orthotic to achieve personalized arch support.

mainEntity.name: Are these good for supination AND plantar fasciitis?
mainEntity.text: Are these good for supination AND plantar fasciitis?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Alice. We recommend the Glycerin 21 for runners/walkers who supinate. It may also be comfortable enough if you are dealing with Plantar Fasciitis. Plantar fasciitis can be tricky to solve with a single shoe as it can be quite different from person to person. Please also keep in mind that we're not doctors and any serious pain or injuries should be discussed with medical professionals. We recommend visiting a local running shop and having your gait and feet analyzed by a Fit Expert. They'll be able to recommend options accordingly. To find a shop near you, check out our Store Locator tool. https://www.brooksrunning.com/en_us/store-locator

mainEntity.name: What are the differences between the ghost 14 and the beast 20?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Paul! The Beast '20 is a Max Support Max Cushion model, while the Ghost 14 is a Neutral Moderate Cushion model. The Beast '20 features our GuideRails¬Æ technology which adds support by keeping excess movement in check. This is recommended for people who overpronate - their feet and/or ankles roll inward as they run or walk. The Beast '20 is also great at accommodating orthotics or inserts. The Ghost 14 does not have our GuideRails¬Æ technology, so it is better for people with a neutral or supinated gait.

acceptedAnswer.text: The footbed and insoles of all of our shoes have the same arch height and arch support. Our shoe styles in our inventory are split into 2 sections, Neutral and Support. The Ariel '20, Addiction GTS 15, Addiction Walker 2 (including V-Strap and Suede versions), and Dyad 11 are all built on a linear last, which generally means that the footbed is slightly wider and the forefoot does not curve upward. This provides more width and volume. The Ariel '20 provides maximum support and maximum cushioning.

mainEntity.name: Difference between glycerin and aerials ?
mainEntity.text: Difference between glycerin and aerials ?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Arle! The Ariel '20 is a Max Support model featuring our GuideRails¬Æ technology that adds support by keeping excess movement in check. It also features soft cushioning thanks to our BioMoGo DNA midsole. The Ariel '20 is built on a linear last, making it a great option to accommodate inserts or orthotics. The most similar model of the Glycerin would be the Glycerin GTS 20, which also features our GuideRails¬Æ technology. The Glycerin GTS 20 features our nitrogen-infused DNA LOFT v3 - super soft cushioning optimized to be lightweight, responsive, and durable with plush comfort. It is built on a curved last and generally will not provide as much volume as the Ariel '20.

mainEntity.name: Can I wash the Ariel 20s in the washing machine?
mainEntity.text: Can I wash the Ariel 20s in the washing machine?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Mary! We do not recommend washing your Arial '20 in the washing machine as they can be too aggressive and cause the shoes to stretch or warp compromising the materials and performance of the shoe. We recommend following these directions to keep your shoes looking and performing their best. Start by removing the internal liner and hand wash the shoes in warm water with mild soap. Make sure not to submerge or soak the shoes in water. Once you're finished cleaning, stuff your shoes with newsprint (plain if you have it) and allow them to air dry. When they are all dried out, you can reinsert the liner.

If you need support directly under your arch, our sock-liners are removable so that you can input your own insole or orthotic to achieve personalized arch support.

Postal worker. Walking route led to a painful lump in bottom of my foot. My foot felt like it had a broken bone for weeks. Within wearing these for one week the pain is gone. Lump might be permanent although ig it can shrink but the pain is gone and it's not getting bigger or worse. Saved my feet. Over 30 miles a week and can be worn daily for 3-5 months before dying. Sounds like they go fast but when you consider the milage and abuse (rain,snow&stair climbing) they receive it's actually quite amazing they last that long. Will be my go-to for my postal career and beyond as long as they keep being produced without negative changes/cost saving reductions.

mainEntity.name: Is this shoe slip resistant enough to wear in a restaurant kitchen?
mainEntity.text: Is this shoe slip resistant enough to wear in a restaurant kitchen?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Hi Brian! Great question! Most of our shoes are specifically designed for run performance, and don't specifically have slip resistance built into them. Though our Addiction Walker 2 shoe offers a slight friction coefficient (enough for wet pavement), they are not up to the specifications required for work shoes who have a certified skid resistance.

We recommend checking out a company like Shoes for Crews to find a certified slip resistant shoe if that's an important feature.

The shoes are true to size and width and are flexible to allow good foot motion while reducing foot fatigue.  The leather is high quality making it a handsome shoe that is appropriate for work, the gym or casual use.

review.name: See above.

review.description: I like the fact that the top of the shoe is constructed with leather and not nylon mesh. Much warmer in the winter. Thanks for offering this style in narrow. Very hard to find.

This is my second pair of Addiction Walker 2.  I walk 2 miles every day in these shoes and after about a year the heels wore out so I had to buy another pair.  They are extremely comfortable - they are supportive for my plantar fasciitis and have a good amount of cushion.  I recommend them for anyone who is on their feet a lot in addition to using them as a walking shoe.  They run small so make sure you measure your feet; I normally wear a 7 1/2 and these are an 8 1/2 wide.
review.name: Extremely comfortable shoes

review.description: I‚Äôve worn the addiction Walker 2, in a narrow width, for 14 years with custom orthotics. They fit perfectly until this year. These were so narrow in the toe box that I could barely get my orthotics in, and walking caused pain in my joints. I exchanged them for the normal width and the fit seems fine after 1 week of breaking in. My return and refund of the first pair was handled quickly.
review.name: Reliable walking shoe w/orthotics

review.description:
I bought these basically out of desperation! I wear a size 12 AA shoe, with a quad A heel, in a perfect world. Finding anything that remotely fits is nigh on impossible. Finding something that fits AND is comfortable, now that is a miracle. Well let me tell you the Addiction 2 is a miracle shoe! From the moment I first put it on it has been comfortable and extremely supportive. I have mobility issues so I have to be careful-these do not slide on dry hardwoods. They are very solid in every way. The shoes appear to be well constructed, there are no gaps or loose adhesives or threads. There is even a little loop to keep the laces straight and the tongue from sliding sideways. My only complaints are basically cosmetic in nature. 1. Why only black and white? More colors as this is the only shoe you have in my size. 2. Why are the laces sooo long? When I tie my shoes the loops AND ends reach the floor! Ok, neither is reason not to buy these shoes.
The Addiction 2 is a great, solid shoe for just about anyone out there.
Buy it, you won‚Äôt regret it.
review.name: A Miracle Shoe

review.description:
I like the support the sneakers give you.
I am not fond of the leather as it is to hard sometimes.

mainEntity.text: I love the ghost series but need all leahter and all white for school should I get the same size as I wear in the ghost series ?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Cecilla! We recommend the same size in the Addiction Walker 2 as you wear in the Ghost. One important difference between these models is the support. The Ghost is a neutral shoe, while the Addiction Walker 2 is a support shoe and features an Extended Progressive Diagonal Rollbar (PDRB). The PDRB is designed to support people who overpronate - their feet and/or ankles roll inward as they walk. If you do not overpronate, this support may be uncomfortable for you. However, we do have our Run Happy Promise: https://www.brooksrunning.com/en_us/brooks-run-happy-promise/

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Candice! In the Addiction Walker 2, the heel height is 29 mm and the forefoot height is 17 mm, creating a midsole drop of 12 mm.

mainEntity.name: On average, how long do these last with M-F wear @ 8 hrs a day?
mainEntity.text: On average, how long do these last with M-F wear @ 8 hrs a day?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Hi Joanne! The general life expectancy of performance running shoes is 300-500 miles and we rigorously test our shoes to ensure they live up to those standards. Replacing your shoes within this cadence ensures that you are getting the kind of performance our shoes are designed for. The Addiction Walker 2 is designed as a walking shoe, so its materials are built to be durable for a similar time frame. 

If you used your shoes as a daily wear shoe, standing in your shoes would be equal to walking up to 2.5 mph, the average person‚Äôs walking speed. Standing in your shoes could be reduced to less than 2 mph, and for 8 hours would be a daily approx. of 10-15 miles of impact to the support and cushioning components of your shoes. In a month you‚Äôd average about 200 miles of wear. We recommend regular rotation of a few pairs of good shoes to ensure the highest level of performance.

mainEntity.name: How often should I replace my Addiction Walker 2 shoes? I‚Äôve seen guidance on your website for running shoes but I‚Äôm curious if the same applies for these walking shoes.
mainEntity.text: How often should I replace my Addiction Walker 2 shoes? I‚Äôve seen guidance on your website for running shoes but I‚Äôm curious if the same applies for these walking shoes.

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Cara! The general life expectancy of performance running shoes is 300-500 miles and we rigorously test our shoes to ensure they live up to those standards. Replacing your shoes within this cadence ensures that you are getting the kind of performance our shoes are designed for. The Addiction Walker 2 is designed as a walking shoe, so its materials are built to be durable for a similar time frame. We recommend regular rotation of a few pairs of good shoes to ensure the highest level of performance.

mainEntity.name: they're slip resistant does that include oil?
mainEntity.text: they're slip resistant does that include oil?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Gen! The Addiction Walker 2 features an innovative outsole that has been certified (SATRA TM144:2011) for slip resistance. It is not OSHA certified.

mainEntity.name: Are these shoes for supinated feet?
mainEntity.text: Are these shoes for supinated feet?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Kristin! The Addiction Walker 2 is ideal for feet that tend to overpronate, have a high degree of calcaneal deviation, or tend to crash in. If you tend to supinate, we recommend our Neutral support styles.

mainEntity.name: Does this shoe have GuideRails?
mainEntity.text: Does this shoe have GuideRails?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Suzie! The Addiction Walker 2 uses the Extended Diagonal Roll bar support application. If you are looking for the GuideRails technology, we recommend the new Addiction GTS 15.

mainEntity.name: Do these shoes have a wide toe box?
mainEntity.text: Do these shoes have a wide toe box?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Judith! The Addiction Walker 2 has plenty of volume within the shoe. Plus, it's available in a Wide width if needed.

mainEntity.name: Are these shoes good for plantar fasciitis ?
mainEntity.text: Are these shoes good for plantar fasciitis ?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Monica! Plantar fasciitis can be tricky to solve with a single shoe as it can be quite different from person to person. The Addiction Walker 2 may be a great option as we recommend finding shoes with a higher drop from heel to toe, good cushion to take the impact away, and sometimes minimal flex to help in case the other benefits aren't enough for your feet. We recommend visiting a local running shop and having your gait and feet analyzed by a Fit Expert. They'll be able to recommend options accordingly. To find a shop near you, check out our Store Locator tool.https://www.brooksrunning.com/en_us/store-locator

mainEntity.name:
Is this good for plantar fasciitis?¬†
Should I wear my orthotics inserts in them?
mainEntity.text:
Is this good for plantar fasciitis?¬†
Should I wear my orthotics inserts in them?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Barbara! Plantar fasciitis can be tricky to solve with a single shoe as it can be quite different from person to person. The Addiction Walker 2 may be a great option as we recommend finding shoes with a higher drop from heel to toe, good cushion to take the impact away, and sometimes minimal flex to help in case the other benefits aren't enough for your feet. This is considered a support shoe, but you can also wear custom orthotics with this style. We recommend visiting a local running shop and having your gait and feet analyzed by a Fit Expert. They'll be able to recommend options accordingly. To find a shop near you, check out our Store Locator tool. https://www.brooksrunning.com/en_us/store-locator

mainEntity.text: Are the Addiction Walker 2 shoes made of leather?

mainEntity.text: What type of leather used? Cowhide?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Abah! We use full-grain leather for the Addiction Walker 2 to promote comfort and durability.

mainEntity.name: Will this shoe support lateral movement as in tennis or pickle ball?
mainEntity.text: Will this shoe support lateral movement as in tennis or pickle ball?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Jeri! The support in the Addiction Walker 2 and our other Support styles are on the medial side. Our styles do not have support for lateral movements, but if you would like to wear our styles for Tennis or Pickle Ball, we recommend our Neutral styles like the Revel 5.

mainEntity.name: Needing non slip shoes to be a server. Are these going to keep me from slipping on oil grease?
mainEntity.text: Needing non slip shoes to be a server. Are these going to keep me from slipping on oil grease?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi there! Most of our shoes are specifically designed for run performance and don't specifically have slip resistance built into them. Though our Addiction Walker shoe offers a slight friction coefficient (enough for wet pavement), they are not up to the specifications required for work shoes that have a certified skid resistance. We recommend checking out a company like Shoes for Crews to find a certified slip-resistant shoe if that's an important feature.

mainEntity.text: What happened to the bone color shoe ?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi there! Check out the Women's Addiction Walker Suede.

mainEntity.text: My feet tend to get hot, is the leather breathable that allows air to flow?

acceptedAnswer.text: Hi Josie! The Addiction Walker 2 has perforated holes in the leather upper for breathability. If you want to achieve the same cushion and support as the Addiction Walker 2, but with maximal breathability, we recommend the Addiction 14.

mainEntity.text: Does the new design of the addiction walker run smaller than the old design?
